Sentencas: A novel methodology, called in-situ solid state reaction (SSR), is developed and achieved for the densification of gadolinia doped ceria (CGO) barrier layer (BL) within the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) technology.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction

Sentencas: The method is based on the combined use of impregnation technique and a designed two-step sintering process to promote the densification of the CGO-BL on dense yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction

Sentencas: A pre-sintering step is carried out at temperature T-1 (1150-1250 degrees C) to obtain porous and interconnected CGO-BL on dense electrolyte substrate.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction

Sentencas: Impregnation of the porous BL is then carried out with small amount of either cobalt or copper nitrate solutions as sintering aids.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction

Sentencas: Final sintering of the CGO-BL at temperature T-2 (1250-1275 degrees C, T-2 > T-1) is used to promote an SSR between the sintering aid and CGO-BL to obtain densification and grain growth.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction

Sentencas: The approach proposed in this work was proved on both screen printed and tape cast CGO-BL, showing feasibility for the densification of generic ceramic multilayer systems undergoing different constrained sintering conditions and for a large variety of materials.
Titulo: Densification of Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 barrier layer by in-situ solid state reaction
